description: A flag when set to true, only allows new Allocation Pool Hierarchies in the request.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to the Allocation Pool Hierarchy instance that you can edit.

Allocation_Pool_Hierarchy_Data.description: The name of this Allocation Pool Hierarchy. It's a required value, and must be unique except when you have the Include ID flag set to true.
The Reference ID of the Allocation Pool Hierarchy.
A flag when set to true, includes the Allocation Pool Hierarchy ID in the display name.
A flag when set to true, inactivates the Allocation Pool Hierarchy.

Organization_SubtypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Organization_SubtypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Organization_SubtypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Allocation_Pool_Hierarchy_Data.description: The reference to the Organization Subtype for this Allocation Pool Hierarchy.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Allocation_Pool_HierarchyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Allocation_Pool_Hierarchy_Data.description: The reference to the direct parents of this Allocation Pool Hierarchy.

Allocation_PoolObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Allocation_PoolObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Allocation_PoolObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Allocation_Pool_Hierarchy_Data.description: Reference to the Allocation Pools included in this Allocation Pool Hierarchy.

description: Contains all allocation pool hierarchy data based on the Request References or Request Criteria. The data returned is the current information as of the dates in the response filter, and does not include all historical information.

validation.validation: Specify a unique Allocation Pool Hierarchy name or select Y in the Include Allocation Pool Hierarchy ID in Name field.
To update an existing Allocation Pool Hierarchy, specify the original Allocation Pool Hierarchy Reference ID.
Specify an active Superior Allocation Pool Hierarchy.
Specify Allocation Pools that aren't already in use in the same hierarchy tree.

You’ve either set the Add Only flag to true, or left the Allocation Pool Hierarchy Reference ID blank. Also, the Inactive flag associated with the pool hierarchy data is set to true. To create an inactive allocation pool hierarchy, leave the Superior Allocation Pool Hierarchy Reference and the Allocation Pool Reference fields blank.

However, if the Superior Allocation Pool Hierarchy Reference and or the Allocation Pool Reference fields can't be blank, then set the Inactive flag associated with the pool hierarchy data to false.
Specify a superior Allocation Pool Hierarchy that's different from this Allocation Pool Hierarchy.
Specify a superior Allocation Pool Hierarchy that isn't a descendant of this Allocation Pool Hierarchy.
Specify the Inactive flag as false because this Allocation Pool Hierarchy either has active Allocation Pools or active child Allocation Pool Hierarchies.
To edit the superior Allocation Pool Hierarchy or Allocation Pools, specify the Inactive flag as false.
